elements.title: They Already Charged You for Ingestion
elements.problem: By the time Snowflake or Databricks filters your data, you've ALREADY PAID for ingestion. The damage is done. It's like a restaurant charging you for food, then offering to throw half away after you pay.
elements.expanso_solution: We filter BEFORE ingestion. You never pay for data you don't need.

elements.title: Misaligned Incentives
elements.problem: Platform vendors make MORE money when you store MORE data. Their business model depends on volume growth. Asking them to reduce your data is like asking a restaurant to recommend you order less food.
elements.expanso_solution: We make money when you SAVE money. Our incentives are aligned with yours.

elements.title: Cloud-Only = Too Late
elements.problem: Platform features only work AFTER data reaches the cloud. Your network bandwidth is already consumed. Your egress fees are already paid. Your compliance risk is already incurred (PII crossed the network boundary).
elements.expanso_solution: We work at the SOURCE‚Äîbefore network transfer, before egress fees, before PII leaves your environment.

elements.title: Single-Platform Lock-In
elements.problem: Snowflake features only help with Snowflake. Databricks features only help with Databricks. You need separate solutions for Splunk, Datadog, etc. More tools = more complexity = more cost.
elements.expanso_solution: Single solution reduces ALL platforms simultaneously. One deployment, universal savings.

presentation_notes.opening: Great question. A lot of people ask this: 'Can't we just use Snowflake's or Databricks' features?' The short answer is no‚Äîand here's why.

card_by_card.card_1: [Point to card 1] First, they've already charged you for ingestion. By the time Snowflake filters your data, you've ALREADY PAID for it. The damage is done. It's like a restaurant charging you for food, then offering to throw half away after you pay. [Pause] We filter BEFORE ingestion. You never pay for data you don't need.
card_by_card.card_2: [Point to card 2] Second, misaligned incentives. Platform vendors make MORE money when you store MORE data. Their business model depends on volume growth. Asking them to reduce your data is like asking a restaurant to recommend you order less food. [Pause] We make money when you SAVE money. Our incentives are aligned with yours.
card_by_card.card_3: [Point to card 3] Third, cloud-only means too late. Platform features only work AFTER data reaches the cloud. Your network bandwidth is already consumed. Your egress fees are already paid. Your compliance risk is already incurred‚ÄîPII has crossed the network boundary. [Pause] We work at the SOURCE‚Äîbefore network transfer, before egress fees, before PII leaves your environment.
card_by_card.card_4: [Point to card 4] Fourth, single-platform lock-in. Snowflake features only help with Snowflake. Databricks features only help with Databricks. You need separate solutions for Splunk, Datadog, etc. More tools equals more complexity equals more cost. [Pause] We're a single solution that reduces ALL platforms simultaneously. One deployment, universal savings.

presentation_notes.analogy: [Point to analogy box] Here's the analogy: You don't use the garbage disposal to reduce grocery bills‚Äîyou buy less at the store.
presentation_notes.closing: Platform features are designed to optimize what's already there. We're designed to reduce what gets there in the first place. That's the fundamental difference.
presentation_notes.when_to_use: When prospect asks 'Why can't we just use [platform] features?' or during technical evaluation

use_case: When prospects question the need for a separate solution vs platform-native features
